Dear Ms. Thomas:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
June 3, 2022. Due to the violation, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due by July 6, 2022 and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (866) 685-0006.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan.
(1) The social service worker shall complete, sign, and
date an updated treatment plan for each resident at
least once every 90-calendar days following the
initial treatment plan.
One of one updated treatment plan was not in the youth’s file. It
was later located in electronic form unsigned by the social
service supervisor. The supervisor signed the plan and placed
it in the file four months after it was due.
2.) ISEP requirements do not apply to this facility as they do not accept placement of
youth who are in the foster care or juvenile justice systems.
3.) This facility contracts with Housing and Homeless Services. This report was forwarded
to the contract monitor, Lynn Nee.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following area:
During this licensing period, the Human Resources Department at Alternatives for
Girls transitioned from paper to electronic employee files. I strongly recommend they
utilize the former employee checklist to assure that all required pre-hire documents
are obtained prior to hire.

None

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care or corporal
punishment during this licensing period.
The facility had no DCWL investigations, and no corrective action plans were
required during this licensing period.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the facility will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
